terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs
Class EnableInputDragFilter

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs.EnableInputDragFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
EnableTarget, InputCancelTarget, InputDragTarget
public class EnableInputDragFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements InputDragTarget, InputCancelTarget, EnableTarget

A special input drag filter that enables and disables the passage of drag events, defaulting to enabled. This filter should only be used with sensors monitoring the same display canvas otherwise its operation is undefined. Input events are used as follows:

  • InputDragTarget: Input drag.
  • InputCancelTarget: Cancels any active drag. Causes the output drag position to return to its starting position and blocks further dragging until drag stop.
  • EnableTarget: Enables and disables dragging, with drag starts and stops issued as needed.

Because drag events are state sensitive (see below), unlike with other events, this filter is the sole means for enabling and disabling input drag events other than disabling the sensor itself.

To accommodate drags being enabled and disabled in mid-stride, if a drag is active when disable occurs the output drag will be terminated. If a drag is active when an enable occurs or if no drag is active but a "do drag" event occurs then the output drag will be initiate.
